summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Form OBD 211, a Request for Financial Information, used to authorize reimbursement to a financial institution for providing subpoenaed records. It is associated with case number 2019801188 and involves a subpoena to SunTrust Bank. The document outlines the procedure and certification requirements under the Right to Financial Privacy Act.

persons.name: Anthony Baker
persons.context: Named in the instructions as the person to whom a copy of the form and subpoena should be sent.

events.title: Financial records request prepared
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney prepared a request for financial information (Form OBD 211) for case number 2019801188, authorizing reimbursement to SunTrust Bank for providing subpoenaed records.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY Accounts Payable, 86 Chambers Street, 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007
SunTrust Bank (financial institution, specific address not provided in text)
keyFacts: The document is a standardized DOJ form (OBD 211) used to request and pay for financial records obtained via subpoena under the Right to Financial Privacy Act.
It is linked to a specific federal case numbered 2019801188, which is likely related to the Epstein investigation given the document set.
The financial institution targeted for records is SunTrust Bank.
The form includes strict certification that the records pertain only to individuals or small partnerships (five or fewer), not corporations.
The request was prepared on December 11, 2019, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to the case at that time.
